titleInfo.title: Letter No. 1127 from Charles Norris, Chief Secretary to Government, Bombay, to Samuel Hennell, Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire

mods.abstract: In this letter, received 8 November 1834, Charles Norris, Chief Secretary to Government, Bombay, encloses a copy of a letter, dated 26 June 1834, which he has received from David Anderson Blane, who is writing from the Honourable Company's sloop of war Amherst, concerning present conditions of Bassidore [Bāsa‘īdū] and recommending certain alterations to the present buildings at that station. Norris informs Samuel Hennell that the Governor in Council, John Fitzgibbon, feels himself precluded at present from sanctioning any outlay on the buildings at Bassidore. In his letter, Blane discusses the advantages of Bassidore as a port and then makes detailed suggestions for improvements to the buildings there.
